title: Freedmen's Bureau Records: George T. Cook to R. S. Lacey, October 26, 1866
summary: Cook responds to Irwin's letter to General Schofield. He provides more details on the case to which Irwin referred, stating that he believes these particular charges to be just. Cook does, on the other hand, concede that blacks must tread very lightly around whites, and the abuse of blacks by whites is unfortunately frequent.
keywords: Legal System, Violence/Crime, Race Relations, Slavery, American Civil War
